20.<center>ー 優美なる夜明け ー|ヌッジォ・ラ・ヌァグータ 画|<br>|:
ー The Graceful Dawn ー| Nugio La Naguta, painting.|
|It depicts the dawn of the demon world|realistically with light colors and a delicate|touch. It's a more subdued style compared to|
|his other paintings.

21.<center>ー 朝食 その悲しみ ー|マデサゴーラ 画|<br>|なんと 大:
ー Breakfast The Sadness ー| Madesagora, painting.|
|A painting by the Great Demon King Madesagora|is on display...|You took a long look at it.|
|It's a painting with a geometric pattern that|fills the canvas with creative shapes. You|can't quite figure out what's breakfast and|
|what's sad.

22.<center>ー 森（愛にも似た景色） ー|ヒューデン 画|<br>|森らしき:
ー The Forest (A View Resmbling Love) ー| Huden, painting.|
|A blood-like stain and a line resembling the|shape of an eye are drawn over a forest|landscape.|
|The painting makes you feel uneasy when you|look at it.

23.<center>ー 復讐の旅立ち ー|サ・ラジョンナ 画|<br>|まばゆい光の:
ー Departure of Revenge ー| Sa Lajonna, painting.|
|It depicts a demon leaving for somewhere in|the midst of blinding light. Maybe the motif|is the Great Demon King going off to Astoltia.

24.<center>ー こごえるウドラー ー|シジュラン・チー 画|<br>|ウドラ:
ー Freezing Treevil ー| Sijran Chi, painting.|
|It's looks like a picture of a creature in the|process of freezing that doesn't even look|like a Treevil, but is it imaginary or real?

25.<center>ー 大輪なる戦火 ー|フェルバンドー 画|<br>|燃え盛る炎を:
ー The Great War Fire ー| Felbando, painting.|
|The demons that fight against the blazing fire|are depicted with a powerful touch.

26.テーブルの上に|色あざやかな表紙の本が 置いてある。|どうやら 誰かの日記帳のよ:
There is a book on the table with a colorful|cover. It looks like someone's diary.|
|It's been a long time since he left this|country. By now, he must have traveled to|Astoltia to see the beauty of the landscape.|
|Why did he leave me here without saying a|word? I've been thinking about it for a long|time, but I can't come up with an answer. I|
|had dreamed so much about the day we would|leave together. I can't keep repeating the|same question over and over again. Now all the|
|memories of our good times have faded, and all|I can do is hope for the day when this pain|will fade as well.
